content.description:
On solid rock to the right of

Freaks and Geeks

, V7/8, there are a couple more lines.

Start in front of the big boulder just right of

Freaks and Geeks

, and you can finish either on the arete or on the same finish as

Freaks and Geeks

, V1 ish?

Start on the right side of the same face before turning the corner, and you can finish either on

Freaks and Geeks

or you can finish on the arete, V0 ish?

Of these, the easiest is starting right and finishing left. The hardest is starting left and finishing right on the arete.

Both good lines are on solid rock.
content.protection: If you want to be able to safely fall off the top, it's nice to have 3 pads and a spotter. It's always possible on these less-well-travelled sections of Lower Chaos to find loose rock. Take care.
content.location:
On the Bushpilot Boulder, there is an 8 foot section of rock past

Freaks and Geeks

, the well chalked V8.

content.description:
This problem is one of the classics of the park. Start as for

Bush Pilot

but head right just before that route's last crux, and traverse across fairly good but widely spaced crimps to an obvious exit on lower-angled rock.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter. A rock behind the problem warrants some care.
content.location:
It is on the south side of the boulder, starting in the

Bush Pilot

dihedral.

content.description:
Start far right on the "

Bush Pilot

" Boulder, trend right, and top out above a talus boulder on the ground.
content.location: It is on the Bush Pilot Boulder.

content.description: Bush Pilot starts in a dihedral and goes up.
content.location: It is easy to find, one of the first few in the canyon.
